meanings.definition: To file (a document) before the official filing date.
meanings.sent1: She decided to prefiling her taxes to avoid any last-minute rush.
meanings.sent2: Lawyers often prefiling important legal documents to ensure they are submitted on time.
meanings.sent3: John thought he could outsmart the system by prefiling his homework before the due date.
meanings.sent4: Prefiling your paperwork is like planting seeds early for a bountiful harvest of organization.
meanings.sent5: The company's success was attributed to their practice of prefiling all necessary paperwork diligently.

meanings.definition: The act of filing a document before the official filing date.
meanings.sent1: Prefiling can save you from the stress of last-minute submissions.
meanings.sent2: The prefiling of the report allowed for a smooth and timely process.
meanings.sent3: The office celebrated a prefiling party to mark the completion of their tasks ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent4: Her prefiling of the application set a new standard for efficiency in the department.
meanings.sent5: The benefits of prefiling became evident when they avoided the chaos of the deadline day.
